abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority says it will move to recover any profits New York City’s famed train and bus thief Darius McCollum would earn if his story is turned in Hollywood movie as planned; McCollum, who first gained notoriety in 1981 when he took over controls of train in Manhattan at age 15, has been arrested more than two dozen times since and is currently in jail at Rikers Island on charges that he stole Greyhound bus in 2015.
lead_paragraph: The transportation authority said it would move to recover any money Darius McCollum may make from selling the story of his thefts of trains and buses for a film in development starring Julia Roberts.

headline.main: M.T.A., as Victim, Wants Transit Thief’s Profits From Hollywood Movie Deal
headline.print_headline: As Victim, M.T.A. Wants Transit Thief’s Profits From Hollywood Movie Deal
